item.title: As a trafficker pursued dreams of soccer glory, investigators closed in
item.dc:creator: Kevin Sieff
item.description: Sebastian Marset bounced from team to team as he indulged his soccer fantasy, sold tons of cocaine and tried to stay ahead of the law.

item.title: A double life: The cocaine kingpin who hid as a professional soccer player
item.dc:creator: Kevin Sieff
item.description: A trafficker in Latin America used his wealth to buy professional soccer teams and then fulfilled a boyhood dream: He inserted himself into the starting lineups.

item.title: Iran denies plot against Trump, after U.S. reports unspecified threat
item.dc:creator: Niha Masih
item.description: U.S. intelligence officials have warned that Iran may seek to avenge the 2020 assassination of Iranian commander Qasem Soleimani, which was authorized by Trump.

item.title: Hezbollah leader threatens new attacks on Israeli towns as tensions rise
item.dc:creator: Suzan Haidamous, Maham Javaid
item.description: Hezbollah leader Hasan Nasrallah struck a victorious tone in a speech, claiming Israel has been exhausted by the fighting in Gaza and external pressures.

item.title: Pentagon ends troubled Gaza pier mission, shifts focus to Israeli port
item.dc:creator: Alex Horton, Dan Lamothe
item.description: The Gaza pier operation directed by President Biden enabled the delivery of millions of pounds of food but faced near-constant complications.

item.title: China suspends nuclear talks with the U.S. over Taiwan arms sales
item.dc:creator: Cate Cadell, Abigail Hauslohner
item.description: The Chinese announcement comes as U.S. policy on Taiwan hangs in the balance ahead of the November election.

item.title: King’s Speech and parliamentary pomp mark major power shift in U.K.
item.dc:creator: William Booth, Karla Adam
item.description: During the State Opening of Parliament, King Charles wore a heavy crown, and the theatrics of the constitutional monarchy were on full display.

item.title: Paris mayor swims in the Seine, declares it clean for the Olympics
item.dc:creator: Rick Noack
item.description: “It’s pure happiness,” Paris Mayor Anne Hidalgo said, having fulfilled her pledge to clean up the Seine before the Games. Now officials hope it stays that way.

item.title: Cyanide, found in cups, probably killed 6 in Bangkok hotel room, officials say
item.dc:creator: Annabelle Timsit, Wilawan Watcharasakwej
item.description: Officials suspect the two Americans and four Vietnamese died of poisoning at the Grand Hyatt Erawan Bangkok and may have been involved in a business dispute.

item.title: Wall Street Journal fires Hong Kong reporter who headed embattled press club
item.dc:creator: Shibani Mahtani
item.description: The Hong Kong Journalists Association has been accused in recent weeks by state-run media outlets in Hong Kong and China of destabilizing the city.

item.title: As mobilization rules kick in, some Ukrainian men pay to flee, dodging draft
item.dc:creator: Isabelle Khurshudyan, Kostiantyn Khudov
item.description: Some Ukrainian men are paying thousands of dollars to dodge the draft by hiring smugglers to escape the country as key provisions of a mobilization law take hold.

item.title: A rarely seen Amazon tribe emerges from rainforest as loggers move in
item.dc:creator: Rachel Pannett
item.description: Footage shows the isolated Mashco Piro tribe just miles from where logging companies have been granted concessions in the Peruvian Amazon.

item.title: Most birds avoid hurricanes. This species chases them, scientists say.
item.dc:creator: Kyle Melnick
item.description: A study found that Desertas petrels, rare seabirds that live on a Portuguese island, follow hurricanes for days to search for prey in the Atlantic Ocean.

item.title: Hamas launched ‘systematic’ attack on civilians on Oct. 7, report finds
item.dc:creator: Bryan Pietsch
item.description: A report by Human Rights Watch concluded Hamas targeted civilians intentionally, committing war crimes such as torture and the use of “human shields.”

item.title: J.D. Vance’s vocal admiration for Orban’s Hungary tells its own story
item.dc:creator: Ishaan Tharoor
item.description: On the eve of the Republican National Convention, consider the party’s transformation into one of the world’s leading illiberal nationalist movements.

item.title: White House touts drop in border crossings to counter GOP crime focus
item.dc:creator: Nick Miroff
item.description: Illegal crossings along U.S.-Mexico border have declined more than 50 percent in the weeks since President Biden used emergency measures to curb asylum access.

item.title: Trump will push for hasty peace in Ukraine if elected, Hungary’s Orban says
item.dc:creator: Mikhail Klimentov
item.description: The Hungarian leader proposed that the E.U. consider changing its policy on the war in Ukraine, in a letter to European Council leadership that echoed Trump’s foreign policy preferences.

item.title: 2 Americans among 6 found dead in Bangkok hotel room, officials say
item.dc:creator: Bryan Pietsch, Wilawan Watcharasakwej
item.description: An initial investigation indicates they were killed, say police, who found a spread of room service including fully consumed beverages and untouched food.

item.title: Israel says half of Hamas military leadership killed since Oct. 7
item.dc:creator: Adam Taylor
item.description: The announcement, which The Washington Post could not independently verify, came as local health authorities said 60 people were killed in strikes across Gaza.

item.title: Russia convicts writer Masha Gessen; reporter Gershkovich seeks faster trial
item.dc:creator: Robyn Dixon
item.description: In two politicized cases, Gessen, a Russian-born writer, is convicted of spreading fake news while Wall Street Journal reporter Evan Gershkovich is charged with espionage.

item.title: ‘Long live Donald Trump’: Indians express their support after shooting
item.dc:creator: Karishma Mehrotra
item.description: For many leaders and supporters of India’s ruling BJP, the struggles of Donald Trump mirror their own battles against the opposition.

item.title: Across river from lavish Indian wedding, frustration and flooded streets
item.dc:creator: Gerry Shih, Anant Gupta
item.description: The extravagant nuptials of Anant Ambani were a national Rorschach test: awe-inspiring showcase of Indian affluence or indictment of lopsided development?

item.title: Housing, once the ticket to wealth in China, is now draining fortunes
item.dc:creator: Christian Shepherd, Lyric Li
item.description: Communist Party officials are meeting this week to try to stabilize the slowing Chinese economy. But they’re not tackling the biggest problem: the property crisis.
